title: How to Leave a Voicemail Without Calling: Easy Workarounds

steps.title: Open your Phone app.
steps.content: Open your Phone app. SlyDial is a service that allows you to leave a voicemail without waiting for the call to time out. You'll just need to dial the SlyDial number to use the service directly from your phone or landline. [1] X Research source Keep in mind that this is a third-party service, so you should refrain from sharing personal or sensitive information. While you don't need to install SlyDial's mobile app to leave voicemail without calling, they do offer an app version of their service. You can download it from the App Store or Google Play Store . You'll just need to create an account first.

steps.title: Dial 267-759-3425.
steps.content: Dial 267-759-3425 . This is the SlyDial number. Once connected, an ad will begin to play. Wait for the ad to end. SlyDial offers a paid subscription to skip this ad, but it's not needed to use the service.

steps.title: At the prompt, enter the recipient's phone number.
steps.content: At the prompt, enter the recipient's phone number. This should be the full 10-digit phone number you are trying to avoid calling.

steps.title: At the prompt, speak your message.
steps.content: At the prompt, speak your message. The automated voice will let you know when it's time to record your voicemail. When you're finished, you can hang up. The voicemail will be sent to the recipient's inbox under SlyDial's number or as "Unknown number". Be sure to include your name and a way to contact you back if needed. You can use SlyDial as many times as you'd like; you'll just need to wait for the ad to end before sending another voicemail.

steps.title: Access your voicemail.
steps.content: Access your voicemail. The steps to access your voicemail will differ depending on your carrier, but you can usually dial a specific number to access it. Some carriers allow you to send messages from your voicemail box. This feature may not be available for all carriers. For example, if you're using Xfinity mobile service , you can access your voicemail by dialing *99.

steps.title: Navigate to the "leave a message" option.
steps.content: Navigate to the "leave a message" option. The automated voice should give you a few prompts. Select the ones that allow you to leave a message. If you don't hear this option, it's likely unavailable for your carrier.

steps.title: Enter the recipient's phone number.
steps.content: Enter the recipient's phone number. This is the full 10-digit phone number.

steps.title: At the prompt, speak your message.
steps.content: At the prompt, speak your message. The automated voice will let you know when it's time to record your voicemail. When you're finished, you can hang up. Your message will be sent to the recipient using your caller ID (if enabled).

steps.title: Text the recipient instead.
steps.content: Text the recipient instead. If you don't want to use a third-party service like SlyDial, or your carrier doesn't offer voicemail messaging, you can try sending a text instead. Most phones have the option to send a voice recording if you don't want to type out a normal text. If you are using an iPhone and the person you're trying to reach also has an iPhone, you can send a voice message through iMessage .

steps.title: Call during busy hours.
steps.content: Call during busy hours. If you know the recipient is busy or may have Do Not Disturb enabled, this is a good time to call without worrying about the other person answering. They may not be able to answer on time, and you can access their voicemail freely.

steps.title: Try calling two numbers at once.
steps.content: Try calling two numbers at once. Dial another number (such as your home phone), and then dial the actual recipient's number after. This will place two calls at once. When the second number sends you to voicemail, cancel the first number.

steps.title: Call from a different number.
steps.content: Call from a different number. If you have another phone number, such as one from a Voice over Internet Protocol (VoIP) like Google Voice , you can try calling the recipient from there. If the recipient is unfamiliar with that phone number, they may ignore your call or send you straight to voicemail.

steps.title: You can use SlyDial or your voicemail's options to send a voicemail.
steps.content: You can use SlyDial or your voicemail's options to send a voicemail. If you don't want the recipient to see you dialing, you can use SlyDial to record and send a voicemail directly to their inbox. If your carrier allows it, you can also use your voicemail options to do so. Alternatively, you can send a text, call during busy hours, or place two calls and cancel the first to reach the second's voicemail. You can also try calling from a number that the recipient doesn't know.
Don't leave any voicemails you'll regret. Even with third-party services, calls can be tracked down if escalated high enough.
